name: Sigma +921
standards.note: Cut 5 (HPPE), some exact sub-scores not provided
features: High cut resistance (Cut 5); Good grip in oily/dry environments
why: Made with HPPE fiber and Cut Level 5, ideal for handling sharp materials in oily environments.

name: Sigma +911
best_for: Fine metalwork; General tasks with cut risk
why: Cost-efficient glove with strong cut protection and good dexterity for fine metalwork.

name: Sigma 922
why: Balanced comfort and cut protection for light-to-medium duties.

name: Sigma 412 (Latex)
why: Latex coating with anti-slip grip; great for general tasks and wet surfaces.

name: Sigma 418 (Latex)
why: Clean latex knit with solid grip; suited for general work and light assembly.

name: Sigma +422 (Latex)
why: Latex with higher tensile strength and anti-slip; a more robust general-purpose option.

name: Sigma 432 (Latex)
features: Higher durability; Grip in wet/slippery conditions
why: Latex with fuller coverage and higher durability; good for wet and slippery conditions.

name: Sigma +434 (Terry/Latex)
why: Warm terry liner with latex coating for winter use and solid grip.

name: Sigma +446 (Textured Latex)
features: Hand warmth; Excellent grip when wet
why: Warm liner and textured latex grip for cold or wet conditions.

name: Sigma +485 (Latex Foam)
why: Foam coating provides excellent grip and breathability for long use.

name: Sigma 348 (Nitrile)
standards.note: Oil/solvent resistant; EN374 details may be needed
why: Nitrile-coated for oil and chemical resistance, ideal for petrochemical environments.

name: Sigma +342 (Nitrile)
why: Nitrile for oils and solvents with high durability.

name: Sigma 344 (Nitrile)
features: Better durability & puncture resistance; Suited for heavy tasks
why: Reinforced nitrile; suitable for solvents and oils in heavy-duty work.

name: Sigma 346 (Nitrile)
features: High durability; Oil grip; Reinforced fingertips
why: Durable nitrile with reinforced fingertips; ideal for oily, heavy-duty tasks.

name: Sigma 332 (Nitrile)
why: Full nitrile for oils and solvents with high durability.

name: Sigma 312 (Nitrile)
why: Industrial nitrile with good puncture resistance; suitable for oily/petro work.
